issue.description: The name of the attributes "allowed_values" should be "allowed_value" and the name of the attribute "classified_entities" should be classified_entity.

It is not specified what happens to the inherited mandatory attributes of entities in the mim. For example what value(s) are allowable for the attribute_classification_assignment.role attribute that is inherited by the applied_attribute_classification_assignment entity? The role attribute in this case might be considered ambiguous to some. The guidelines recommend values for these attributes may be documented in the "Module implementation and usage guide" annex of the application module - but none was found. I suggest that this is added with a list of the entities/attributes concerned and marked for further assessment when a usage guide is developed (else these will be lost until implementers begin their work causing confusion later on).

It seems that Attribute_classification.classified_entity would better be of an aggregate data type (SET for example). Consider the name of a unit to be classified this way. With the current solution each instance of unit, the name of which is supposed to be in the class of unit names, requires an instance of Attribute_classification (each of which relates to the same Class). With an aggregate type attribute this proliferation of Attribute_classification instances would be avoided.
Change Attribute_classification.classified_entity to be an aggregate data type (SET).

description.p: What is the scope of the reference data when the data type of the attribue with the name Attribute_classification.name is an entity data type (and not a simple data type)? How much of the information that is related to the entity data type can the user expect to find in an external library (if such is used via External_class)?
The question applies similarly to Classification_assignment.
Provide an informal proposition in attribute_classification module that states:
The type of the attribute that is being classified shall not be an entity data type.
